contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|calyx}} '''Calyx''' or '''Calyce''' (plural "calyces") may refer to: ==Science== * [[Major calyx]], the convergence of two or three minor calyxes in the kidney * [[Minor calyx]], a calyx in the kidney that surrounds the apex of the renal pyramids * [[Calyx of Held]], a large synapse in the auditory brainstem structure * [[Calyx (anatomy)]], the crown of a crinoid * Calyx, the collective name for [[sepal]]s of a flower * ''[[Eubela calyx]]'', species of sea snail ==Other uses== * [[Calyx (artist)]], UK producer of drum and bass * [[Calyx (fictional moon)]], a fictional moon in ''Colony Wars'' * [[Calyx (magazine)|''Calyx'' (magazine)]], a literary journal * [[Calyce (mythology)]], a figure in Greek mythology * 'Calyx', a textile design by [[Lucienne Day]] * 'Calyx', a song by Hatfield and the North from their album [[Hatfield and the North (album)]] * [[CALYX]], publisher ==See also== * [[Calix (disambiguation)]] {{disambiguation}}
